I was recently introduced to them. I never put much faith into the results until I completed my own enneagram. The personality profile that resulted was fairly accurate with the way my co workers claim to view me as well as the way I view myself. 
 
 Anyone have experence with these things? If so do you put any stock in their results?

post_info.post_title: Enneagram: Put any faith in them?

What are they? Never heard of them, are we taking personality test based off series of questions, or a reading with mystic crystals or what?
 
 If its not to long any chance we could see a sample reading (maybe yours if its not too personal) to gain better insight?

I took the online test and this was my result.
 
 
 Type Two 
 The Helper
 The caring, interpersonal type. Twos are empathetic, sincere, and warm-hearted. They are friendly, generous, and self-sacrificing, but can also be sentimental, flattering, and people-pleasing. They are well-meaning and driven to be close to others, but can slip into doing things for others in order to be needed. They typically have problems with possessiveness and with acknowledging their own needs. At their Best: unselfish and altruistic, they have unconditional love for others.

As for such analyses requiring faith, such "tests" are attempts to generalize character using (or more accurately, perhaps, misusing) decades-worth of empirically-gathered behavioral science research. 
 
 Unlike, e.g., astrology, which attempts to do the same based on pseudo-science that doesn't begin to pass muster with scientific method.
 
 The former may or may not be accurate, but its methods can be tested and shown to be accurate or not, because it is based on observable real-world evidence (i.e., human behavior).
 
 Astrology, on the other hand, has to be taken completely on faith, because there is no empirical evidence linking the movement and positions of stars and planets light-years away to the personality types exhibited by humanoids on our planet.

Only because you asked :)
 
 investigator:
 The perceptive, cerebral type. Fives are alert, insightful, and curious. They are able to concentrate and focus on developing complex ideas and skills. Independent, innovative, and inventive, they can also become preoccupied with their thoughts and imaginary constructs. They become detached, yet high-strung and intense. They typically have problems with eccentricity, nihilism, and isolation. At their Best: visionary pioneers, often ahead of their time, and able to see the world in an entirely new way. 
 
 Labels seem silly given the complexity of who most of us are. Even the test showed very high in a number of "types", but then labels me as type 5 since it was scored the highest. I also didn't like the questions, but enough complaining :) It's also more of a reflection of how we view ourselves, which can often be different than how we are observed as being by others...
 
 I'm definitely not a #2...I think the best person to decide your needs is you, to require someone else to mind-read and determine your needs, then have them provide those needs, seems inefficient to me ;). Likewise, I think not providing for your own needs is often a result of low self-esteem (other's needs are more important). Amusingly enough I think most of our personality traits are evolutionarily driven, and I think low self-esteem is a very important mechanism of survival, as is social behavior. How's that for convoluted reasoning! :)
 
 Then again I'm sure I'll be more of a type 2 when I have (hopefully) children. Big Orn as grandpa better be a type 2! :)
